answers.answer: Swelling can be a normal part of pregnancy, be sure you're getting enough fluids. It can also be a sign of a pregnancy condition called preaclampsia which is also associated with high blood pressure. I would call your OB and inform them of your swelling and they can better assist you. Best of luck!

It could be normal, and im not tryna scare you. But you should see your dr. just in case too. Depending on urine and blood test, it could be preeclampsia too. I wouldnt worry to much. See your dr. Good luck!
Water, water, water, and elevate your feet.

question: What do u do for swollen feet and hands? Hopen its part of being pregnant. This is my 4th pregnancy. Haven't had this before. I am at 33 weeks.
title: swollen feet and hand
